titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Mary Elizabeth Garrett (1854-1915) was a well-known Baltimore philanthropist and suffragist. She was M. Carey Thomas's devoted friend and a benefactress of Bryn Mawr College.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Mary Garrett. Materials include: correspondence with her mother and other family members; diaries and address books; invitations and calling cards; correspondence and other papers relating to her estate, stock holdings, and other financial matters; bills and receipts; letters to John W. Garrett from his sons; and documents relating to the estate of John W. Garrett.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
